title: New Zealand head coach Steve Hansen defends England's response to haka, saying V-shape was 'fantastic'
text:
Steve Hansen, the New Zealand head coach, has defended England's response to the haka, labelling their V-shape formation ahead of Saturday's semi-final as "fantastic" and "brilliant".

Eddie Jones' side have been fined £2,000 by World Rugby after six of their players crossed the halfway line as they received the challenge, breaching tournament rules.

World Rugby issued the fine on Tuesday night but have been heavily criticised for doing so having heavily promoted a video of the incident – which has been viewed over four million times – on YouTube.
